title: How to Braise Celery

steps.headline: Wash and chop the celery.
steps.description: Start with eight stalks of celery. Thoroughly scrub the celery, running it under water to clean it. Cut off the brown ends, and peel off the extra chewy part on the outside of the celery if you prefer. Chop the celery into 1-inch pieces. Onions and celery make a nice addition to this dish, but you'll need to cook them a little before adding the celery.

steps.headline: Cook the celery in butter.
steps.description: Place a medium-sized skillet over medium heat. Let the butter melt in it. Add the celery into the pan. Sprinkle on a dash of salt and pepper. Leave the celery uncovered, cooking it about 5 minutes and stirring it occasionally.

steps.headline: Add the broth or stock.
steps.description: After the celery starts to cook a bit, pour the broth in. Beef broth is best, but chicken or vegetable broth would also work. Mix it in with the celery. Put the lid on the skillet, and reduce the heat. Let the celery cook for another 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Reduce the liquid and serve.
steps.description: Take the lid off. Let the liquid reduce down. You don't want celery soup. Rather, the liquid should thicken a bit and coat the celery. You'll only need to cook it for approximately another 5 minutes. For a bit of freshness, add a tablespoon of finely chopped fresh parsley before reducing the liquid.

methods.name: Creating Braised Celery With Dijon Sauce

steps.headline: Wash and chop celery.
steps.description: Make sure to wash the celery thoroughly, and cut off the brown ends. You can also pull off the stringy fibers from the back, if you'd like. Cut each stalk in half, width-wise. They should be about 6 inches each. Dice the shallot finely. You should have about 3 tablespoons. If you don't have shallots around, you can replace them with minced garlic or onions.

steps.headline: Cook the celery in oil.
steps.description: Place a medium skillet (that has a lid) over medium heat. Add some oil, and let it heat up. Add the celery to the skillet, and let it cook by itself for a couple of minutes. Once it's cooked a bit, add in the shallot. Pour in the stock (1 cup), as well as a dash of white wine. Chicken or vegetable stock works best for this recipe. In place of the wine, you can use vermouth or a dash of white grape juice.

steps.headline: Let the celery braise.
steps.description: Put the lid on the skillet. The lid traps the moisture, which is what finishes cooking the celery. Let it cook for about 20 minutes or a little longer. The celery should be soft and tender when it's done.

steps.headline: Create the sauce.
steps.description: In a small bowl, add the 2 tablespoons of Dijon mustard. You can add a bit more if you prefer. You'll also need the 2 tablespoons of vinegar and the 2 tablespoons of lemon juice. Mix it together thoroughly.

steps.headline: Finish the celery and sauce.
steps.description: Take just the celery out of the pan. Using a fine-mesh strainer, pour off liquid, saving the shallots. Mix the shallots into the dressing, along with the 1/2 cup of olive oil. Pour the sauce over the celery to finish.

steps.headline: Prep the stove and oven.
steps.description: Add a pot to the stove filled with water. The pot should be big enough to hold the celery, but don't add it yet. Salt the water, and then let it heat to boiling. You'll need to turn it to high heat to get it to boil. Turn the oven on to 400 degrees Fahrenheit.

steps.headline: Prep the foods.
steps.description: Wash the celery thoroughly. Cut the celery hearts in half, lengthwise. Also trim off the brown ends. Peel the onion and garlic, then slice it. Wash and cut the lemon into slices. Parboil the celery by adding it to the water once it starts to boil. You'll only cook it for about 3 minutes. Drain off the water, and use paper towels to dry the celery. Place the celery in a baking dish.

steps.headline: Cook the onion and garlic.
steps.description: Add a tablespoon of oil to a medium skillet. Let it heat up a bit over medium heat, then throw in the onions. Add a dash of salt. Let it cook a bit before adding the garlic. Let it cook together for a minute or two. The garlic will burn if you add it at the same time as the onion.

steps.headline: Add the braising liquids.
steps.description: Pour in the cup of stock. Chicken or vegetable stock is best for this recipe. Also add in the 1/4 cup of white wine and the 2 tablespoons of lemon. Let it come to a boil, mixing with the onions and garlic. If you don't have white wine, you can use dry vermouth, white wine vinegar, or a bit more stock.

steps.headline: Add the braising liquid to the celery.
steps.description: Carefully spoon or pour the liquid over the celery in the baking dish, being sure to get the garlic and onions, too. Add a dash of salt and pepper. Layer the lemon over the top. Make sure the dish is covered, then set it in the oven.

steps.headline: Finishing the dish.
steps.description: Take the celery out of the oven. Let it cool for a bit before taking the celery out. Place the liquid back into the skillet boil. Let it cook down about halfway. Once it's done, add it back to the celery. Add the parsley and the tablespoon of oil on top, along with a grind of fresh pepper. You can use dried parsley if you don't have fresh, but add it to the liquid as you're reducing it. This dish is best served cold. You can also serve it at room temperature.
